conclusion: Two parallel plates A and B create a uniform electric field; electron injected from point O with initial velocity v₀ = 4 × 10⁶ m/s perpendicular to the electric field; electron's velocity at point C makes a 30° angle with its initial direction; e = 1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ C; m = 0.91 × 10⁻³⁰ kg.
Set up coordinate system with x-axis along initial velocity direction and y-axis along electric field direction.
Determine time taken to reach point C: t = L/vₓ, where vₓ = v₀ = 4 × 10⁶ m/s.
Find y-component of velocity at point C: vᵧ = vₓ × tan(30°) = 2.31 × 10⁶ m/s.
Determine acceleration due to electric field: aᵧ = F/m = eE/m; rearrange to find E: E = (vᵧm·vₓ)/(eL).
Calculate final velocity and kinetic energy: v = √(vₓ² + vᵧ²) = 4.62 × 10⁶ m/s; KE = ½mv² = 9.71 × 10⁻¹⁸ J.
